images.subHtml: Photo by Alex MacLean: 'Suncor Oil Sands Project. Piles of uncovered petrolum coke, a byproduct of upgrading tar sands oil to synthetic crude.'

Photo by Alex MacLean: 'Smoke, steam, and gas flares rise from the Suncor upgrading facility. Reclamation efforts seen to the right, on what was once a tailing pond. Suncor has reclaimed only 7 per cent of their total land disturbance.'
Photo by Alex MacLean: 'Mining operations at the North Steepbank Extension. Suncor mine, Alberta, Canada.'
Photo by Alex MacLean: 'Syncrude Mildred Lake mining site. View south to upgrading facility with rising plumes of steam and smoke. Alberta, Canada.'
Photo by Alex MacLean: 'Overview of tailing pond at Suncor mining site.'
Photo by Alex MacLean: 'Seismic lines and well pad for exploratory drilling through the boreal forest at the Suncor Firebag Oil Sands Project. Alberta, Canada.'
Photo by Alex MacLean: 'Growing pyramids of sulfur, a byproduct of upgrading bitumen. Mildred Lake, Alberta, Canada.'
Photo by Alex MacLean: 'Earthen wall to tailing pond. Suncor mining site, Alberta, Canada.'
Photo by Alex MacLean: 'Hot waste filling tailing pond. Suncor mining site, Alberta, Canada.'
Photo by Alex MacLean: 'Surface oil on tailing pond. Suncor mine near Fort McMurray.'
